summary: The manifest folder defines the core data model and serialization logic for dataset versioning, serving as the source of truth for dataset state. It implements content-addressable versioning through deterministic hashing and supports both legacy absolute URIs and modern portable relative keys.
responsibilities: Define the structural schema for dataset versions including tables, artifacts, and bindings.
Implement deterministic SHA-256 version hashing based on canonical JSON representation.
Enforce data integrity and portability invariants (e.g., forbidding machine-specific paths in published manifests).
Provide bidirectional serialization between Python dataclasses and JSON dictionaries.
Manage the transition from legacy absolute URIs to portable relative keys resolved against location hints.
